title: India says new EV policy will open up market to global players
summary: India's government expressed confidence that its newly introduced electric vehicle policy measures will create opportunities for international manufacturers to enter the Indian market, according to statements from the country's Department of Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade.
content:
India is taking bold steps to expand its electric vehicle market through new policy measures aimed at attracting global manufacturers. According to the country's secretary of the Department of Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade, the government is confident these initiatives will successfully open up opportunities for international players.

Last month, the government introduced comprehensive measures to streamline market entry for foreign EV manufacturers, signaling India's commitment to accelerating its transition to electric mobility. The policy changes are designed to reduce barriers to entry while maintaining quality standards for the Indian consumer market.

The move comes as India positions itself as an attractive destination for EV manufacturing and aims to increase the adoption of electric vehicles across the country.

## Policy Initiative
